intro: Mikania pove, commonly known as the creeping wisteria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, oval-shaped leaves that are oppositely arranged along the stems. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and abandoned fields. Mikania pove is known for its rapid growth and ability to form dense mats, which can make it an invasive species in some regions.
